content:
far as
we know these neuron firings are a very large part of the cause of thirst.
Now obviously there is more to be said, for example, about the relations of
the hypothalamic responses to the rest of the brain, about other things going
on in the hypothalamus, and about the possible distinctions between the
feelingof thirst and the urgeto drink. Let us suppose we have filled out the
story with the rest of the biochemical causal account of thirst.
